page.title: 03FARMING IN ILMINGTON 11
page.content:
{Silage}is grass which is fed to cattle in the winter time as an alternative to{hay}.The green grass is mown, collected and stored in a{clamp}or {tower}.It is packed in evenly and sealed in with a plastic sheet.Then in the{winter}time a machine called a{ {Precision Forager}feeds the silage to a trough which the cattle feed from.
{Organic Farming}is a method of farming which does not use gases,chemicals or fertiliser.Instead the farmers plough the land and use{manure}from the cowshed to feed the fields.On one farm,York Farm, the farmer keeps cows,pigs,a milking cow,chickens and goats which the farmer also milks.York Farm is half a mile outside{Ilmington} and it is much smaller than the other farms in our block.
